meanings.definition: To take care of or manage
meanings.sent1: She must mense the garden by watering the plants daily.
meanings.sent2: He always menses his finances by budgeting wisely.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to mense the house by rearranging the furniture.
meanings.sent4: The teacher needed to mense the classroom chaos before the lesson.
meanings.sent5: It is important to mense your time effectively to achieve your goals.

meanings.definition: To behave in a proper or dignified manner
meanings.sent1: The students were expected to mense themselves during the assembly.
meanings.sent2: She always menses in front of guests to show respect.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to mense at the formal event but couldn't stop juggling.
meanings.sent4: The actor had to mense his emotions during the sad scene.
meanings.sent5: It is crucial to mense appropriately in professional settings.

meanings.sent1: December is my favorite mense because of the holidays.
meanings.sent2: In which mense were you born?
meanings.sent3: The mense of May brings beautiful flowers and warm weather.
meanings.sent4: The mense of August always feels too hot for outdoor activities.
meanings.sent5: During the mense of October, the leaves change color in a beautiful display.
